intro: Bufonia macrosperma var. trinervia, commonly known as the Trinervia bufonia, is a member of the Fabaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its compound leaves with three to five leaflets, which are typically hairy and arranged in a pinnate fashion. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
